content.rendered:
This Week in Genesis, a free theme from Brian Gardner, a new Genesis project from Tonya Mork, and some of the things you might’ve missed last week when your favourite weekly Genesis round-up took a summer break.

Themes

Continuing his series of releasing free (and awesome) minimal Genesis themes, Brian Gardner launches the stunning Twenty Seven this week.

Twenty Seven Pro — A (Free) Lifestyle Theme — https://t.co/VPIj3YOSNn #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/uf3OeAjITm

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 1, 2016

Plus, he’s also been teasing a new theme over on Dribbble and Instagram too.

And here’s a teaser of a theme I’m designing for @studiopress — https://t.co/RAF8GWG6oY #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 1, 2016

Next up, a premium photography theme release from the folks at Imagely featuring a very minimal homepage, Simplicity.

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, ‘Simplicity’ a striking new #genesiswp theme from @imagely https://t.co/3sfCEJJmvX pic.twitter.com/jMHAYmOan6

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) September 1, 2016

If you missed it, Shay Bocks’ Cook’d Pro theme is now on StudioPress.

Cook'd Pro: Appetizing Minimalist Theme by @feastdesignco available @studiopress https://t.co/qdlnfzCVgr #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/8CslA59Co1

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 24, 2016

Showcase

Jamie Mitchell for layeredpixels.com.au

@iamnickdavis Custom #genesiswp #agency #webdesign for https://t.co/xhc5OtZx4g pic.twitter.com/jVHHwW6Zkf

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) September 2, 2016

Alexandra Spalato for greattoworkwith.nl

my last work on #genesiswp is online https://t.co/pJzB12VLLJ

— Alexandra Spalato (@alexadark) August 31, 2016

Carrie Koehmstedt with a new site on the Parallax Pro theme.

New website design for @authorkalinde using Parallax Pro theme from #GenesisWP including W… https://t.co/23ZQyDnKEw pic.twitter.com/nfnF4NJ5c1

— carrie loves (@carrieloves) August 30, 2016

Petter Shilling with a new site (on the ever popular Showcase Pro theme) for pottertravel.com.au

Ta Daah! New #WordPress site for Potter Travel ! #genesiswp https://t.co/cuHgVJbaKO pic.twitter.com/TnboOhQqEI

— Peter Shilling (@PShilling) August 30, 2016

Podcasts

Two new episodes from StudioPress.fm, each with a different member of the Genesis community. First up, a beginner’s guide to SEO that works with Rebecca Gill.

New on StudioPress FM: A Beginner’s Guide to SEO that Works with @rebeccagill — https://t.co/4rPj3gtP4B #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/f2co6Y2ILM

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 24, 2016

And then the business of food blogging with Shay Bocks.

New Episode! The Business of Food Blogging: Is it Lucrative? https://t.co/uJHCiWGqEN (with @feastdesignco) pic.twitter.com/5w9bPfhRFZ

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 31, 2016

Plus there’s a few other peeps from the Genesis community to look forward to as well…

Oh man, @bgardner, @laurenmancke, & I had fun recording #StudioPressFM this morning (out in a couple of weeks). Let's talk about #genesiswp

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) August 24, 2016

Had a blast chatting with @bgardner and @brianbourn for https://t.co/FylecR3DQX … Subscribe now so you don't miss the show #podcast

— Jennifer Bourn (@jenniferbourn) August 31, 2016

Meanwhile, over on OfficeHours.fm another Genesis community member, Carrie Dils, brought down the curtain on season 2 with a chat on WordPress and e-commerce with Beka Rice.

My new sounds: WordPress and Ecommerce, Episode 116 https://t.co/FjnIIjrImH on #SoundCloud

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) August 26, 2016

Best of the rest

Andrea Whitmer on why you don’t need to update your Genesis child theme.

No, You Don’t Need to Update Your Genesis Child Theme (Source: Nuts and Bolts Media) https://t.co/8p4PgVTmcK #dailybolt

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) September 1, 2016

Plus, an update to her Genesis Custom Footer plugin.

Want to change your #genesiswp footer credits? My free plugin can handle that – no coding required. https://t.co/3Ehg9fMUKW

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) August 31, 2016

(And it’s being well received already).

A big thanks to @nutsandbolts for the new update. It works with all #genesisWP themes now!! Genesis Custom Footer https://t.co/HFlhWqPYJ3

— Anita C. (@TheCre8tiveDiva) August 31, 2016

Showcase regular Shaan Nicol would love your vote for the submission of his new site to the awwwards website

Hey friends! I’d really appreciate some votes on my submission of the chillybin site to awwwards https://t.co/WMHg3U2m8r #genesiswp

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) August 30, 2016

That man Brian Gardner again with a simple solution to monitor downloads from your WordPress website.

A Simple Solution to Monitor Downloads — https://t.co/l7EPB2xFyI #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) August 24, 2016

And from one Genesis guide to another, Brian Gardner put together his ultimate Genesis guide over on his blog.

The Ultimate Genesis Guide — https://t.co/0iBEMSEY9n #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/ZrDxIBWEzt

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 22, 2016

Sridhar Katakam on how to add featured images before entries on single posts in Genesis.

How to add featured images before entry on single Posts in Genesis:https://t.co/rLVpBCIZwd#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/nxGqXDCfg4

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 28, 2016

And finally…

Tonya Mork (of Know The Code fame) is launching a whole raft of new WordPress initiatives, under the name UpTech Labs.

Tonya expands her mission & offers. Exciting things ahead: https://t.co/lgvtzg4ykm via @hellofromTonya #wordpress #genesiswp

— Christoph Herr (@Christoph_Herr) August 31, 2016

Apart from improvements and new content on Know The Code, the one that might be of most interest to many of you is Genesis Factory.

Wouldn't it be lovely to click a few buttons and poof…custom #GenesisWP code is done?! Coming soon…to save you time, effort, and money.

— GenesisFactory (@GenesisFactory) August 30, 2016

Designed to “automatically generate high-quality, well-tested source code for Genesis themes”, Genesis Factory looks like one to keep an eye on.

And if that wasn’t enough she’s also published a new book on refactoring code.

Check out the Refactoring Tweaks Bundle https://t.co/Ar0lbZMnOT by Tonya Mork @hellofromTonya https://t.co/QX6mb5KyPo

— Leanpub (@leanpub) August 27, 2016

Best of luck to Tonya with everything she’s doing!

excerpt.rendered: A free theme from Brian Gardner, a new Genesis project from Tonya Mork, and some of the things you might’ve missed when your favourite weekly Genesis round-up took a little summer break last week,
